summary: This document is a chain of emails from 2021 between law enforcement personnel regarding the technical analysis of 'Epstein motion capture videos' or 'Epstein surveillance video CD's' submitted to the FBI's Computer Analysis Response Team (CART). The emails discuss delays in processing due to resource allocation to the January 6th Capitol attack investigation.

persons.name: Detective HYPO
persons.role: Detective, FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: Appears as the primary investigator or point of contact repeatedly checking on the progress of analyzing Epstein-related video evidence. Mentioned in emails from April 29, 2021, and earlier.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator
persons.role: FBI Computer Analysis Response Team Coordinator
persons.context: The FBI technical coordinator responsible for the analysis of the Epstein video evidence, providing updates on delays and technical approaches (e.g., loading data into 'Tit' for viewing).

persons.name: SaI (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: An FBI recipient copied on the email chain regarding the Epstein video analysis project.

persons.name: aixigen
persons.context: A recipient copied on the April 30, 2021, email update about the video analysis.

persons.name: M, (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: An FBI recipient of emails in January 2021 regarding the video analysis, to whom a message for SDNY (Southern District of New York) was to be passed.

connections.description: Detective HYPO is repeatedly checking with the NY CART Coordinator for updates on the technical analysis of Epstein video evidence.
The NY CART Coordinator communicates with M, (NY) (FBI) about the status of the video analysis and the need to pass a message to SDNY.

events.title: Capitol Attack Diverts FBI Resources
events.description: The email from January 16, 2021, states that almost all of the FBI's video capabilities were focused on the investigation of the attack on the U.S. Capitol, causing a delay in analyzing Epstein-related video evidence.

events.title: Update on Epstein Video Analysis
events.description: An email update indicates video files are being copied to a different system with better tools, with an expected follow-up the following Monday.

keyFacts: The FBI's Computer Analysis Response Team (CART) was actively processing 'Epstein motion capture videos' or 'surveillance video CD's' as of early 2021.
Analysis of the Epstein video evidence was delayed because the FBI's video capabilities were largely redirected to investigate the January 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol.
The emails show ongoing follow-up by a detective from an FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force over several months to check on the progress of this technical analysis.
The document is subject to a protective order, restricting the disclosure of specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17).
